title: Wilsons policy in 1914 on war in Europe - goal

content.prompt: When war broke out in Europe in 1914, President Woodrow Wilson established a policy that called for

choices.label: immediate American aid to the Allied powers
acknowledgment of American neutral rights on the high seas
American trade with Europe on a cash-and-carry basis only
a strict embargo on trade with all warring nations
strict prohibition of American travel on the ships of belligerents

topic.text: 7.5: World War I - Military and Diplomacy

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
